design_philosophy.core_principle: Digital Sanctuary: Every interaction should feel like a deep breath.

headings.usage: Use for all main titles (H1-H3). It conveys trust and literary warmth.

body.usage: Use for all paragraphs, UI text, and buttons. Its rounded nature feels friendly.

rules: No generic 'tech blue'. Use Deep Sage (#4A6741) for primary actions.
Backgrounds should never be stark white unless it's a card. Use #F9F7F2 (Bone) for the page bg.

layout_strategy.spacing_scale: Generous. Use p-8 to p-24 for section padding.

cards.style: Flat white surface, high padding (p-8), soft shadow (shadow-xl shadow-black/5).
cards.border: No border, or very subtle 1px border-stone-100.

inputs.style: Understated. bg-stone-50 border-stone-200 focus:border-primary focus:ring-1 focus:ring-primary rounded-lg

assessment_ui.option_card: cursor-pointer border-2 border-transparent hover:border-primary/50 hover:bg-primary/5 transition-all

visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle noise overlay on the background (opacity 0.03) to reduce digital flatness.
visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use sparingly for sticky headers. backdrop-blur-md bg-white/80 border-b border-stone-100/50.

media.image_style: Soft, natural light, organic subjects. No harsh studio lighting.
media.icons: Use 'Lucide React' with stroke-width={1.5} for elegance.

instructions_to_main_agent.step_2: Update 'tailwind.config.js' with the custom color palette and font families.
instructions_to_main_agent.step_3: Create a 'Layout' component that wraps the app with the noise texture and warm background.
instructions_to_main_agent.step_4: Build the 'AssessmentCard' component using the Bento Grid principles (some cards wider than others).
instructions_to_main_agent.step_5: Ensure the 'Results' page is extremely gentle. Use soft colors for scores, not harsh reds/greens.

UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
